page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: The majority of housing in the area consists of large farm houses and farm workers houses. The exception of course is Rhynie itself. It originally consisted of one long street and a square with the church at the end. Houses over 70 years old were built on the other main roads leading out of the settlment. Between the World War 1 and the 1950's over 60 council houses were built. These being either semi-detached or terraced. In the last 5 years these houses have been extensively modernised with the installation of central heating, new bathroom, kitchens and insulation. Private housing has been on a one off basis and as such are notable for their size being detached and normally with three or more bedrooms and all of individual design. These houses, like the earlier council housing, are
